body_html:
Have you tried initializing local variables as well? Maybe you have a local dependency in your function some_function.

sess.run([tf.global_variables_initializer(), tf.local_variables_initializer()])

If you can provide a code that reproduces the problem, it can be easier to debug. I ran the lines you provided, but they work fine here. ;-)
body_text:
Have you tried initializing local variables as well? Maybe you have a local dependency in your function some_function.
sess.run([tf.global_variables_initializer(), tf.local_variables_initializer()])
If you can provide a code that reproduces the problem, it can be easier to debug. I ran the lines you provided, but they work fine here. ;-)
body:
Have you tried initializing local variables as well? Maybe you have a local dependency in your function `some_function`.

`sess.run([tf.global_variables_initializer(), tf.local_variables_initializer()])`

If you can provide a code that reproduces the problem, it can be easier to debug. I ran the lines you provided, but they work fine here. ;-)
